sentences.english: Lack of concentration is a sign of your( )(able)to overcome the distracters.
sentences.chinese: 注意力不够集中是你在克服困境时的一处硬伤。

sentences.english: Who transfers a hard wound down in the night sky?
sentences.chinese: 谁在夜空划下一道硬伤？

sentences.english: This paper points out five shortcomings in the present definitions of curriculum.
sentences.chinese: 现有的课程定义有五大硬伤。

sentences.english: In this background, the absence of system prevents the healthy development of share market.
sentences.chinese: 在这种背景下，制度的缺乏成为股市健康发展的硬伤。

sentences.english: But there's a big hitch in Obama's reasoning.
sentences.chinese: 但是在奥巴马的解释中有一项硬伤。

definition: short stave of the barrel (which allows the contents to escape)/(fig.) shortcoming/weak point
a faulty stroke in calligraphy or painting/a faulty expression in writing
lame (unimpressive)/a huge letdown/not to try at all
hard lump in the abdomen (in Chinese medicine)/crux of an issue/main point in an argument/sticking point/deadlock in negotiations
lit. a blemish does not obscure jade's luster/the pros outweigh the cons (idiom)
everything is fine except for one small defect (idiom); the fly in the ointment
